metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1323 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The simulate dbus method in aptdaemon before 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu3.1 as packaged in Ubuntu 15.04, before 1.1.1+bzr980-0ubuntu1.1 as packaged in Ubuntu 14.10, before 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2 as packaged in Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, before 0.43+bzr805-0ubuntu10 as packaged in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS allows local users to obtain sensitive information, or access files with root permissions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

aptdaemon - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
aptdaemon-data - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python-aptdaemon - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python-aptdaemon-gtk - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python-aptdaemon.gtk3widgets - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python-aptdaemon.gtkwidgets - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python3-aptdaemon - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python3-aptdaemon.gtk3widgets - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python3-aptdaemon.pkcompat - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
python3-aptdaemon.test - 1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aptdaemon package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1-1ubuntu5.2').
